Reviews.Title: “Perfect but too hot!”
Reviews.Author: JannyD22
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Aparthotel in February, had a pretty large room, 2 separate beds as requested, a small sitting-area, a kitchen (no waterheater or coffeemaking-facilities; that's complementary) and a large bathroom. Everything was perfectly clean. Staff was friendly. No complaints about noise, quiet and safe (Eixample) area. But: the whole day and night the room is hot and there's no way to regulate this. The window can be opened but won't stay open. I found it rather uncomfortable to sleep in this atmosphere. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, there are plenty of opportunities in the neigbourhood (we ate nearby for € 3,50 per person each morning). Tip: small cheap good restaurant: Taverna d'Urgell near the hotel. Location 50 meters from metro Hospital de Clinic.

Reviews.Title: “Found used condom in the bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: kaufro
Reviews.Content: Finding a used condom under the bed was so disgusting that I almost forgot about the view leading to a wall, the telephone that took 36 hours to be replaced, the breakfast that came incomplete and the breakfast order that was ignored altogether. Calling this a 4* hotel is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay with efficient service”
Reviews.Author: DSL2009
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find from the metro stop; about 60 metres. A wide selection of bars, restaurants and small shops nearby. Very efficient check in an check out. The room was of a very good standard with a small two element electric stove. Wi-fi was good. We needed a cork screw and one was produced for us within ten miutes - very pleasing! We also arrived a little early and the room was ready for us. We bought a two day transport pass, which included the train trip from the airport to the aparthotel from the information desk within the arrivals hall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, & Service = Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MrOwl08
Reviews.Content: We chose Aparthotel Acacia for a 5-day trip to Barcelona, and were drawn to it for three reasons: a previous positive experience at an apart-hotel in Berlin, an excellent rate, and free Wi-Fi. We could not be more pleased with our choice! The hotel is located in the Eixample neighborhood very near an L5 metro stop, and is a reasonable walking distance from La Pedrera/Casa Batllo. There are plenty of excellent restaurants, cafes, and shops in the surrounding blocks, and high-end shopping on Passeig de Gracia is within 15 min. on foot. Rooms are cozy and efficiently decorated, and the cleaning staff kept both the room space and public areas immaculate. The free Wi-Fi service was unfailingly stable, and it was a real treat to be able to Skype with our kids while we were away. Most importantly, the staff provided customer service as good as any hotel we have patronized in the US or abroad. The reception staff patiently and courteously provided answers to our questions, outstanding recommendations for transportation and eating, and were ready to make us as comfortable as possible in every regard. We loved Barcelona and would readily have added a few more days to the trip if it were possible, and our stay at Acacia was a big part of that sentiment! Meal service is available, but we chose not to partake of this. A few reviewers mentioned that the beds were very firm, and this is very much the case. Mattresses are firmer in Europe that those we are accustomed to in the States anyway, but these are really hard--something to consider if you prefer to really sink into your bed. Also, Carrer del Comte d'Urgell is a fairly busy street, and given the late hours the Spanish keep the traffic noise can go on well into the night. We were not terribly disturbed by this, but if you are used to very quiet nights, you should come prepared. If you are planning a trip to Barcelona, Aparthotel Acacia should absolutely be on your shortlist of potential hotels. We had a wonderful stay, and look forward to another if we are fortunate to return to Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: dee r
Reviews.Content: we have just had a 4 nights stay at this hotel and cannot fault the helpfulness of the staff, they helped us map our tour of barcelona and the apartment was also kept very clean.. it was also close enough to the metro station to make it convenient in every way. we were a family of five and never felt cramped in any way.. i would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at this apart/hotel”
Reviews.Author: thirdave1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this aparthotel for 12 nights on the recommendation of friends. We had a wonderful time! It ticks all the boxes - excellent location, terrific staff, a comfortable and very clean room. Just as the others have mentioned - it is close to restaurants and bars, a small supermarket for groceries for the odd meal I cooked and the metro (Hospital Clinic) is 50 metres away. I can't stress how helpful and friendly the staff were - (with a special mention to Maurizio) - anything we needed was provided. For the length of time we spent in Barcelona, this aparthotel was ideal! We ceratinly hope to return sometime soon! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced. Clean and quiet hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: silverbike
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - We stayed in Barcelona with 2 young children for 7 days. The room was clean and maintained well by the cleaning staff. The staff spoke English and were helpful in providing suggestions etc. During time of booking, we requested a non-smoking room closer to the upper floors of the hotel. You can request additional items (check website to determine what is available) prior to booking or even during your stay. The hotel will try to accomodate your requests. Hotel is well situated in a quiet neighbourhood not too far from Las Ramblas. We felt safe walking around the area with our 2 children even late at night! The hotel is very close to one of the Metro stations (Hospital Clinic) and you can easily access the main tourist sites from the Metro. Beware of PICKPOCKETS - especially in the Metro!!! Our room was a large room consisting of a tiny kitchenette, main bedroom, sofa bed (all prepped) and of course bathroom. We found the mattress on the main bed to be very firm and for some this may be hard to sleep in. For us, we were generally so tired from the long days of site-seeing that this didn't make a difference. The sofa bed was more softer! Originally, we ordered breakfast in our room (served by very friendly staff) but later we utilized our kitchenette more and bought our own supplies. For 10 euro, the breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, cereal (very small amount), hams (different types), hot drink and cold drink. We generally ordered 2 orders (total 20euros) which was sufficient for us. To be more economical, we started purchasing food for our own meals -- there are groceries stores close by offering fresh foods. If you require more items for your kitchenette, you can always ask the hotel whether they can supply it (i.e., kettle, microwave). If you were planning of utilizing the kitchenette more, would recommend bringing/ buying paper towels or dishtowels. Would probably have benefited if we had a cutting board (this was on menitoned in another review). We were supplied with at least 2 steak knives that we used for cutting. Other reviewer suggested brininging a 'swiss army' type knife but we didn't need it. Would recommend this hotel and would probably stay here again. Did wish it had a roof top pool for those really hot days!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NualaO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is well located, in a quiet/safe area with plenty of bars, restaurants and shops. The Hospital Clinic metro station is just one block away. The area is also well served by buses, which offer a more direct route to parts of the city centre than the metro. Most of the main attractions are within easy walking distance. Our room was a good size and spotlessly clean. It was exactly as it looks on the website so there were no nasty surprises. The 6' bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. This hotel wouldn't win any design awards and it would not be a great place to stay if you like to spend a lot of time in your hotel room. However, as a base to explore Barcelona it represents excellent value for money and has everything that you might need. We will definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - close to everything, very clean, friendly English speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeD_1969
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed for 3 nights. Location close to Metro station, taxis passing often in front of Hotel. Many restaurants and cafes within walking distance. Room was spacious and very clean; quiet despite it was facing the street. We did not use the kitchenette as we always ate outside the hotel. The unfolded sofa bed in the living was good enough for the two children. It came at an extra price as one of the kids was older than 8. Staff very friendly, English speaking. Good wi-fi Internet service. Highly recommended, we would definitely come back here when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “It's like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: b0h0l
Reviews.Content: Aparthotel Acacia is certainly one of the good hotels I've stayed in, in my almost a month-long vacation across europe.My son and his wife who were also vacationing joined me in barcelona for the last leg of my journey. We stayed in an apartment that's supposed to be good for three people. It turned out it has one large bedroom with a king bed. The third bed was a sofabed in the living room which the maids unfold into a bed at night. The sofabed was very comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping. The apartment is large and has a kitchenette complete with utensils where you can cook your food and dine. However, we never got to do any cooking as we ate our meals outside the hotel. We requested for a kettle when we checked in which we used to boil water for our morning coffee. The room is very clean. The bathroom is large and spotless. The metro is just around the corner making it very convenient to explore the city. There are a lot of very good restaurants around the vicinity patronized by the locals so you really get the feel of the real barcelona. There are several grocery stores nearby. Although the hotel is near a hospital and our room faced the street, we could not hear street or traffic noise inside. The hotel is really value for your money. Will definitely stay here again when in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Spacious,quiet,clean”
Reviews.Author: leicestermancunian
Reviews.Content: It was great to have the extra room afforded by this mini apartment. The room was very quiet, clean with pleasant decor. It was great to be able to have a cup of tea first thing although otherwise we didn't use the catering facilities, there's an excellent cafe next to the metro 5 mins away where you can get a great bacon sandwich. About 25 mins walk to Ramblas or go on the metro, cheap clean and efficient. Acacia highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, spacious, friendly service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: kitstar
Reviews.Content: The hotel very nice and clean. The lower rooms could hear running water from the upper rooms however it didnt spoil the stay. Friendly staff. After reading other reviews we asked for a kettle on arrival and also the key to the room safe (an additional cost) Very close to a metro station so made it easy to get around. Beware of pickpockets as we lost a camera in the lift going down into the metro

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with GREAT service!”
Reviews.Author: sdeshpan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family (total of 8 people). The hotel is located in a quiet section of Barcelona that is very close to the Metro line. We booked two triple rooms and one double room. The triple room consisted of one double bed (two twin beds next to each other) and a fold out bed. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean. The only issue I had with the room was the shower consisted of a glass door that did not fit the entire bathtub, and therefore when taking a shower the bathroom floor would get completely wet. However the shower did have consistent water pressure. The big reason why I recommend this hotel is because the customer service of the front desk was AMAZING! We are large family that can be very loud and demanding at times, and the hotel staff accommodated all of our needs with genuine courtesy and friendliness. We are planning to revisit this hotel at the end our Spain trip for one last night before we head back to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way in and our way out of Spain. Clean, lovely rooms with divided section with loveseat that folds out to a small bed, table, small refrigerator, 2 burner stove, sink and various dishes and pots. If you want a microwave, you have to ask. Room is great for a couple. Probably OK with a small child, too. TV has some English channels, including British news and entertainment but sometimes there are problems with the signals. Wireless internet. You pay a small charge to use the in-room safe. Our first room faced the rear. No view but very quiet. The second room faced the street. There was some noise but not bad. We loved the neighborhood which is upscale and filled with families and students for the nearby school. The Metro is just a few steps away (Hospital Clinic stop, L5) and is easy to use. There are cafes and restaurants everywhere. Two grocery stores are a block away. Cash machines everywhere. If you walk a few blocks up Urgell, you can catch the Bus Turistic near Diagonal. Look for the sign on the west side of the street. The desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. We skipped the hotel breakfast which was expensive and the hotel laundry which cost more per item than the clothes were worth. We Americans are used to toiletries at hotels but you'll just get a liquid all purpose soap and a sewing kit! Bring your own shampoo and lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: scoopy2scoops
Reviews.Content: I'll start of my review by saying that i'm not too sure this hotel should be in the top 100 hotels in Barcelona, it's very good but i'm sure there are 100 better hotels out there. What you do get is a very good sized room at a low rate near to the metro in a nice suburb of Barcelona. The location. Not within reasonable walking distance of the centre but very close to the hospital clinc metro stop on the blue line. You do have to change lines to get into the centre on to the green line but it's only three stops in all. The neighbourhood is nice, middle class - we felt really safe. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby but it's all a little quiet, you need to head into the centre to find the real night life. There's a supermarket close by and a couple of smaller more expensive shops. We never felt too far out but you need to be happy to use the metro. Hotel Clean, friendly staff, solarium on the roof (has to be requested to be setup the day before use). 24hr manned reception, you need to hand the huge room key in to reception everything to leave. Room Large, very very clean, firm but comfy beds. Small kitchenette, you have to request at reception if you want extra equipment like a toaster, microwave and kettle. Ironing board and iron also available on request however they take it away the next day which was a little annoying. Bathroom is large, but as other reviews had said the shower is good but the door leaks. There's a hair dryer, a TV with a few English channels and more importantly free WIFI. Rate We paid about £80 a night, which is pretty good for Barca, Cons: As has mentioned before the rooms have really thin walls, we didn't luckily have any neighbours but we still got a fair bit of plumbing noise (pipes gurgling in the bathroom), phones going - lift noises etc. Having said that I'm a fairly light sleeper and it didn't disturb me too much overall, I wouldn't let it put you off hotel. and of course the location isn't perfect but at least you have the metro stop nearby (which runs all night Saturday and till 2am Fridays). So in short a big room, with handy self catering and a good room rate, in a nice suburb of Barcelona. As for Barca don't believe all the pick pocket scare stories you'll hear on the forums, just take the normal precautions you'd normally take in a large city. We felt fine and much safer than in a UK city.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: CuriousMsM
Reviews.Content: Although we had selected this property based on Trip Advisors, I was still wary of a well priced hotel in a good location. The suite (rooms without walls to the ceiling) was comfortable and spacious. The staff were great. We arrived with two personal problems - a stolen bag and a death in the family. The staff took messages, gave advice, and were very kind. The hotel is very close to a metro and has many restaurants of varying prices nearby. They have a small underground garage.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean, great price, great place”
Reviews.Author: babs430
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Was very close to Metro Stations and within walking distance to some very good restaurants. Within walking distance to some great sites. Staff was very good and the place was spotless. Was nice to have the extra room for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good and nice aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: DannyHaifa
Reviews.Content: the pros: A minute walk from the Metro station. Good Bars, Cafes and Restaurants around. There is a small supermarket 200 mts. from the hotel, and a couple of mini-markets very near. The hotel is situated in a main street, but the rooms have double-glass windows, so there is no noise from the street. Most of the staff at the reception were very helpful, nice, cordial, etc. (I speak Spanish, so I can't tell about their English). When ever we needed something (microwave, kettle) or ask for something to be fixed, the matter was treated care very quickly. The Kitchenette was well provided and as I wrote above if you need something, you will get it if they have what you need. The utensils at the Kitchenette were cleaned every day (we couldn't clean them anyway because of the lack of soap and cleaning tools). The "rooms" are nice and big, as well is the bathroom. The room have wireless and free Internet (fast enough. Have to ask for a password at the reception) and get a free local newspaper every day (in Spanish, don't know if they provide in other languages). the cons: The apartment is actually A big nice room, but it is NOT separated into a bedroom and a salon by a wall, but rather by a nice wood 3/4 high partition, and a sliding door (difficult to notice in the pictures shown at the hotel site, that seems like 2 well separated rooms by a wall) . If you are alone or a couple (even with a young child), then there is no problem. But if you want some privacy or light and noise (laptop keyboard, cooking, etc.) from the other side of the room disturbs you, then there is a problem. We were a couple with our young adult son and it was disturbing. The bathroom is next/linked to the "bedroom" so from the "living-room" you have to go through it. The bed (or sofa) for a third adult is uncomfortable! For a child is good enough. Although there was no noise from the street, we did hear here and there the high volume TV from the neighbor from the other side of the hotel/building wall. (not something the hotel can do about. But I knocked the wall and they understood the hint). By the way TV, I think they should install a second one in the "living room". You can't open windows (besides the bathroom window) in order to refresh the air in the room. We had to ask for toilet paper from the cleaning lady (luckily saw her), something that usually you don't have to ask for in a hotel. Had to buy soap, because when the soap they gave finished, we didn't get any more. We didn't complaint at the reception about those 2 things because we thought it wasn't such a big issue. (but I feel that I have to write it in my review). In conclusion: It seems from my review, that there are more cons than pros. But that is not so. The cons are not cons if you know them in advance when you choose this hotel. The Hotel is nice, clean, very well located and the Room/s is/are big and well equipped. Next time I travel to Barcelona, alone or as a couple, I certainly will consider choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, would recommend to everyone I know.”
Reviews.Author: oledebi65
Reviews.Content: I was looking for ages for somewhere for my boyfriend and I to stay in Barcelona over the New Year. After visiting Trip Advisor I found this place which had great reviews - and they are true! We flew into Barcelona quite late, and after booking the hotel they sent through clear directions from the airport. It was simple, a short RENFE train ride into the centre and then 2 stops on the metro and the hotel is right there. There is someone on reception 24 hours a day so we were welcomed on arrival. The reception looks very clean and well kept. We went up to our room, and there was everything we needed, a small kitchen, table to eat, small lounge, bedroom with TV (and Sky channels) and a bathroom. Even when we had breakfast and rushed out, the cleaner washed up our things! Being so close to the metro meant we could go everywhere easily, the Sagrada Familia was on the same metro line so didn't even have to change. Just buy a T10 and you don't have to worry about buying tickets every time and saves money. Brilliant, was about £100 a night, but for city centre, it was well worth it, to know you're somewhere clean, friendly and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: SnMagician
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay in Barcelona..quiet neighborhood, Metro station within a block to the hotel. The pictures depicted the accomodations exactly. Tha bed was comfortable, albiet low to the floor, but that's fairly typical for Europe. The small sofa wasn't that comfortable.Internet access was good. The staff were friendly and knowledgable of any item I requested. We didn't eat there, breakfast was pricey, but, the kitchenette was nice to have and you can get a microwave on request. There are several restaurants in the vicinity and some great pastry shops. We stayed here before a cruise for 4 days. Then upon return, following a HUGE SNAFU from the rental car co., we called and they were so kind and said, "of course, come on over". After the rude and aggrogant treatment from the rental car folks, it's was great to be treated so well. It's cheaper to book with the hotel directly. (which we found out on our second stay!!) I feel sure we would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: akitas22
Reviews.Content: I selected the Aparthotel Acacia based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. I needed a room for three persons and the Aparthotel Acacia was the highest rated hotel that slept three. The location was in a residential area not a tourist area. But with a metro stop located so nearby - access to Barcelona was easy. The rooms were large by European standards with a small refrigerator and kitchenette. Wi-fi was free. But my concern involves BED BUGS! The morning following our first night there - I noticed four bites on my stomach. But as I had never in my years of travelling experienced bed bugs, I thought nothing of the bites. We spent all day out seeing the sites and went to a late dinner. When we returned for the night, I wen to change into my bed clothes and realized that I was covered with bites on my torso - almost 90 of them!! We were tired and worn out from our first full day in Spain but there was NO WAY that I could sleep in that room (401) . I called to the front desk told them of the bed bug bites and they gave us another room. We packed up all of our belongings and moved to the 6th floor. Just as we were unpacking everything, we were called and told that we needed to move to another room. By the time that we got moved and settled and all keys down to the front desk - it was 1:30. My husband was tired and frustrated and talked to the front desk about compensation - he asked for one night on a five night stay and the front desk told him that he could not authorize it but he was sure that we could do something agreeable. I was freaked out, I spent time researching bed bugs on the internet. And the news is not pleasant. They are difficult to see and terrible to get rid of. They are not necessarily caused by a lack of cleanliness but actually travel with people on their luggage. They hide and come out an hour before dawn. They are very transient and move from room to room and can live for 18 months without feeding but typically feed every 4-5 nights. Needless to say I did not sleep well that night or during our stay there. In hindsight, we should have moved hotels but it was a busy Easter weekend and finding a room for three persons would be difficult. The next morning I went down to the front desk and spoke with the day manager. I even showed him a photo of my back with the bites to show that they did exist. I wanted to know that they took me seriously and treated room 401 extensively. When we returned from that day of touring, I was told that they did not have bugs. They did not allow animals in their hotels and that their hotel is very clean. They offered me a 5% discount or 35 euros not because they believed there to be bed bugs but because they had incovenienced us and had us move twice- ha! - what a joke. I tried to contact the hotel owner directly to ensure that he was aware of my concerns and to ask for further compensation. But I received no response. My bites did not multiply but did continue to get moe uncomfortable and affected my pleasure in the vacation. My husband and daughter also wound up with several bites on them. I continued to read about bed bugs and how to keep from taking them home with me. BED BUGS are nasty - people actually move from their homes because they cannot get rid of them. Upon our arrival home - we were forced to wash everything in the hottest possible water and dry for 20 minutes. Everything and I mean everything was sealed and sterilized or frozen, They even have been known to get into computers so nothing is safe from bed bugs. I have done everything possible to stop the contamination of my home. But I want to warn future travellers to beware of Aparthotel Acacia. Even the cleanest of hotels can suffer with bed bugs. And if the Aparthotel Acacia did not take my situation seriously and treat not only room 401 but the entire hotel as recommended by pest control specialists - the BED BUG infestation will only continue.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks good customer service”
Reviews.Author: romalu
Reviews.Content: Requested room (non-smoking, back of hotel) was not ready when promised so we waited in the lobby for about one hour. When it was still not ready after an hour wait, we decided to go out to eat. When we came back to see our room, it was obviously a smoking room as the air reaked of cigarette smoke. By this time there were no other non-smoking rooms available on the back side of the hotel away from the street so we had to settle with a room facing the noisy street. The room was okay except for ambulance sirens all night long (hotel is near a hospital) and motorcycle noise (numerous in Barcelona). We arrived at the hotel after more than 10 hours of traveling, so we were anxious to get into our room to wash up and relax before we went out to eat. The ensuing problem with the hotel room not being ready, and then not getting the requested room was very disappointing. Also, it was impossible to prevent the shower water from splashing onto the bathroom floor because of the inadequate, dangerous shower door. The room's lights only work when you put the hotel's card key in a slot on the wall. Actually, you can use any hard card, like a credit card to keep the lights on when you go out while someone stays in the room. Avoid wasting your money on the coffee machine in the lobby as the coffee tasted somewhat like sewer water and hotel staff would not reimburse us. Parking (for a fee) under the hotel was very cramped and required numerous maneuvers in reverse to get around the turns. Forget about parking there if your car is larger than a compact car.

Reviews.Title: “Don't arrive on a Sunday!!”
Reviews.Author: RVLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a short break at Aparthotel Acacia. Despite their insistence on knowing when we would arrive the rooms were not ready when we did arrive despite this being later than the check in time and later then we had estimated. One of our party had been taken ill hence our slightly later arrival and despite reception knowng about this distinct lack of interest in getting us our rooms. The light in the kitchenette area in one of the rooms didn't work in all the time we are there and on the last night they offered to change our rooms the next day - when we were due to check out! Shame as the rooms were spotless and well equipped. Arriving on a sunday means that the main supermarket and lots of bars and restuarants in the area were closed - better to get there one day earlier or later. Also in an area called Hospital Clinic gives you a clue - ambulances racing through the traffic sirens blaring! To get to the central tourist areas is a good 15 minutes walk and by metro involves a change. Nice hotel shame about the location and lack of customer focus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenites, good metro location”
Reviews.Author: sxysiv
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Right next to the Hospital Clinic stop on the blue line metro - Good clean spacious suite rooms with kitchenette - Has a luggage hold room - Has hotel parking (if not full) for 10.70 Euros a day - All staff we met speaks English - Small supermarket right nearby - #3 NightBus also stops about 2 blocks away (since Metro stops at 12 am on weekdays/sun). Cons: - shower leaks (due to 1.5 foot length of glass that acts as a curtain) - hard beds - you give them your room key anytime you leave (as with all the hotels I stayed in while in Spain and Portugal) which is very insecure because anyone could go to reception and say "room 210" or whatever, and they would just hand you the key. _______ I would recommend this place to anyone for it is a good deal. Everything was very nice and accessible. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccommended!!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine10
Reviews.Content: On a monthlong solo holiday to Europe, this was my favorite hotel. Friendly staff, spotless rooms and accessible location. My initial reservation was for three nights, but decided to extend two more because of the fantastic accommodations and wonderful city. The rooms were spotless and extremely comfortable, almost like a small apartment complete with sitting room, small kitchenette and plenty of storage room for luggage. All staff, front desk, room attendants, etc., were extremely friendly and helpful. Even upon check-out, the front desk attendant was very helpful in making sure I knew how/where to catch my next train.

Reviews.Title: “A great spot!”
Reviews.Author: paris1949
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at the Acacia for two nights in June before moving to another Barcelona hotel to join friends. This is a great hotel--we had a large, quiet, one-bedroom unit with a large bathroom and small but convenient kitchen area. It was spotlessly clean and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. There are lots of shops and restuarants in the area---one of our best meals during our week in Barcelona was the lunch we had at the restuarant right next door to the hotel (to the right of the hotel when you are facing it ). And as an added bonus the nearest subway station is just 1/2 block away. The hotel is about 8 blocks from Rambla de Catalunya and about a 15-20 min. walk to Placa Catalunya/La Rambla. This would be my hotel pick whenever I next return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family, friendly, clean centrally located Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: deehell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a well-located apartment hotel in L'Eixample area of Barcelona - that's the newer (as in 19th century) bit, based on a grid-layout. This means that it's about 4 blocks from the Passeig de Gracia - the upper level of the most famous Rambla - so about 10-15 minutes flat walk from the main Gaudi houses of La Pedrera and Casa Batillo. There's a metro stop - Hospital Clinic - 50m away. Having lived in Barcelona between 94 and 96, I wanted a hotel that would have on-street parking overnight, bigger rooms but not be too expensive for a family of 5 (although we needed 2 rooms). You don't get this in the Barri Gotic without paying lots of 5* money, and the rooms tend to be smaller. As other reviews remark, you get about 45m2 of space with a separate living area (which has a very comfortable fold-out double bed), small kitchenette with fridge, hob, and basic pots, pans, glasses and cutlery, a good double bedroom and a comfortable spacious bathroom, with good water pressure. All spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds and (a real blessing) totally silent, yet very effective air-conditioning (and opening windows). Loads of really good restaurants nearby - both tapas style and plenty of pizza/pasta ones too. There's a very classy, consistently good one called Vinya-Roel, at c/Villaroel, 190-192 (tel 93-430 7279) that has been in the same hands for more than 13 years - and serves very high quality Spanish food (English, French, menus too) with really reasonably priced wine. About 2 blocks away. There are very fresh patisseries - including a really spendid, traditional one - just opposite - which serve great breakfast pastries and coffee; a Caprabo supermarket one block away (open 9am -9pm) and several late night small shops which will sell you beer, wine, milk and other late night essentials. Reception, chambermaids all very helpful - excellent English too. Can't stress enough that everything very clean, efficient and friendly. We slept really well - it's quiet there too - unlike the Barri Gotic where you get street noise at all hours. It's a few stops away on the metro to get to Plaza Cataluña - the main square at the top of the Ramblas - or you could walk it in about 20 brisk minutes. It made a great base for a 6 day family holiday. We'd certainly go back. Any quibbles - the car park under the hotel would only take very small cars - (but we fed the meter for 2 hours in the morning, and parking is free after 8pm at night, and generally easy to find); and you get "bath gel" rather than shampoo - so we bought our own for a couple of euros. I've stayed in a lot of Barcelona hotels on business - and I would rate this one highly for space, cleanliness, friendliness, and the things that matter like comfortable beds, efficient, quiet AC, a fridge to keep the milk (for cereal and coffee) and beer in. I'd certainly stay there again.
